lines.p: When Israel went out of Egypt,The house of Jacob from a people speaking a foreign language,
Judah became his sanctuary,Israel, his dominion.
The sea saw it and fled;The Jordan turned back.
The mountains skipped about like rams,The hills, like lambs.

What made you flee, O sea?
Why, O Jordan, did you turn back?
Why did you skip about like rams, O mountains,Like lambs, O hills?
Tremble, O earth, because of the Lord,Because of the God of Jacob,
Who turns the rock into a reedy pool of water,The flinty rock into springs of water.
